website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Like many others, I went for their free one year web domain, with their promises of "no strings attached" "Money back guarantee - no questions asked" "No hidden fees". As a freelancer, I set a company up with a free domain and used my own name to initially set up the domain. The company never switched the info to their name and never used the services. Suddenly I am getting harassed by One.com since it's been a year and I owe them $36 some plus a $12 late fee. I figured like most free trials, if unused/unpaid for, they just cancel your account and that's that. Not keep it open and continually come after you for late payments. Granted, perhaps in the fine print they mentioned that you had to cancel 30 days before the expiration period or get charged, but it's still a super shady business model. They are profiting from other's misfortune with their shady services. After contacting them, they did offer to remove the late fee but had very little remorse, and when I tried to pay, my credit card held the payment due to potential fraud by Chase. Way to go, One.com. There website was easy to use, but their business practices are terrible.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: At the time I signed up for this site all basic web service was completely free. I am assuming in a nice semi-hidden way they let me know that if I didn't cancel this "trial" that I would be billed. I took no action on my account. Never used their web building service. And soon forgot about them. Went to their site as a learning experience on website building. So 6 months later I received a bill for $30+, and additional 12.99 late notice fee. No phone support is offered to discuss issues with them. A complete disconnect. So we went back and forth with emails and in the end they had no sympathy. No one should pay for a service that was not used. Companies get paid once a service is actually used, no freebies for businesses. And get a phone. You're supposed to be a professional business.

reviews.review_title: “Great product, cheap as chips but Crap tech support”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text: Cheap as chips, all up and running in no time at all. A fully functional website, domain and unlimited email addresses all within about 24 hours and for about a Tenner ! Seriously impressed with that but......... my attempt to receive support was not great. Support is there via chat and they do respond but.... not really helpful or able to help. Thankfully I resolved the problem well sort of. I switched on spam filer on email and found out by someone informing me that mail was bouncing. one.com support were pretty useless and never got back to me. Thankfully I realised that the spam filter was the only change, switched it off and voila was receiving mail once more. Never heard back from support at all as for some reason unbeknown to me they had to escalate my issue to some other technical department blah blah blah.. and you and I know that means passing the buck ! It may have been a bit of a catastrophe had they not come back to me and had my incoming emails continued to bounce !!!  If you can provide your own support and fingers crossed it keeps running then its great. If you are less tech savvy and need any help, .beware. Fingers crossed all ticking over nicely again. oooo and unlimited email addresses is a nice addition as is free https security cert . I may give tech support another try just to see if it gets any better.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
Cheap is cheap!

I signed up with them less than a week ago. My long-standing, reputable, and functional website was transferred to these scammers for a short period of time. The website, emails, and everything else stopped working as soon as they were transferred to webhostingworld.

I pulled out my embarrassing mistake from their claws very quickly because: 1. The site never saw the world through their eyes! 2. The emails stopped working and I lost business that week. 3. Now I have to correspond with my clients to re-establish my reputation. And it's not easy to do. My clients trust me on the quality of my work and my product. My products, my service, the quality of my communication with the client, and everything else is a part of my business integrity. When I mistakenly signed up with webhostingworld, I temporarily compromised my integrity. 4. Their 30-day money back guarantee promise is a bogus. I submitted a ticket with them. It's like throwing a bottle with a message into the ocean with some communication effort. And it's like being on an island in the ocean screaming for help. Wilson! My ticket was never addressed. Does this ring the bell? 5. They make their money by advertising very cheap plans and charging thousands of people for a promise they don't deliver. When people realize that they paid for nothing, it's too late. The fee is small, so people stop fighting in their efforts to get their money back. As a result, you have lost a small amount of money, your time on the Internet, your reputation with some of your clients (who are inherently patient for the most part, thank Goodness!), and your sanity. And they have collected their undeserved profit while you are trying to get back on your feet.

My advise to you, don't make the same mistake I did. You get what you pay for. And, in this case, it ain't worth it. Never sign up with this company!

P.S. I did allow more than 48 hours for the site to propagate on their so called "server." And I was very patient with their excuses.

reviews.review_title: “Web Hosting World dot net Buyer beware”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I subscribed to Web Hosting World dot net (my 1st 5 posts cant include links per Scam Rules), and the beginning was great. I had the functionality needed to run my 24 hour web store. However as my needs grew, the company stop doing or performing certain duties such as forwarding a copy of the transcript when chatting to my email account. Instead, they send their bias overview so I have to print screen to save a copy. Then the database STOPPED working, first I was told that we are updating your database then it would happen while I was working on the website.  Then someone changed the name of my database from wbandt to bbandt??? I have a screen shot of it also. Then they disabled my options to send emails and I got an error stating  we do not authorize the use of this email account to send bulk mailbut I am a business?!?!? And businesses send bulk mail?? Then the customer service agent called my mail SPAM??? Wtf? But would only allow me to send mail from my cellular device or ipad. 
Then I was not allowed in my cpanel, they would change password, and give me 3 minutes then log me out and I get a message saying you have exceeded the login time now they will not allow me to delete files. This is serious because the content of our files are private and sensitive. They disable the function to delete files from database in cpanel and access to certain script in cpanel. These issues are a security breach. When asked WHY my database and other issues were happening, I got NO answer but we will send a ticket to next levellike Comcast does (but that is another story). Since using their hosting company I have lost privilege to post ads on my site as the companies are saying I no longer have the traffic???? But other analytics who point to my site says I get at least 90 clicks per daymy site has ZERO visitors according to Web Hosting World dot net.  I am now waiting for them to allow access but just decided to delete the databases altogether. For some odd reason I believe they have files somewhere!?!? Its Thanksgiving Folks so I am gonna organize records for your deliberation. Simply put, this company is DEATH to businesses that rely on the website for branding. They are real cheap, but you will take a greater loss by using them.

reviews.review_text:
I was with Webhostingworld.net for 2 years. After the first year the hosting continued to go down hill. It was more like 75% uptime. They must have started me off on the good server, then after a time moved my site to a less functional server or something. The customer service had gotten so bad that they would simply paste a link in the chat to direct you elsewhere. General questions like "why is my site down"? Would now require a support ticket. I moved my site to another host, it costs more, but I am getting what I pay for...so-to-speak. I referred WHW hosting to others in the past who either ended up retrieving a refund before the end of 30 days which WHW makes very difficult; or if they missed the 30 day money back, they simply moved their site. I moved my sites, but WARNED others that WHW was a frustration but an inexpensive way to get set-up....THAT'S ALL!!!. Unfortunately, not many people are as patient as I was.

I am now building a site for a customer who insisted on inexpensive hosting just to get the feel of managing her own website. So I came back to WHW. I knew what to expect, but I am here to enlighten others that after 3 years it has simply gotten worse. 

My new experience: It has been 3 days and the site is still not activated. The temporary url does not work either. For the last 3 days I have been told that the site will be up in just a few hours. The home page states "Free Set-up and Instant Activation", that's fine if in your language "instant" means 3 days; regarding the 30 day money back guarantee, on the second day that the site was not up I asked how I go about getting a refund, I have been continually told the site would be up in just a few hours. Going into day 4 I am still being told to wait just a few hours.

MY RECOMMENDATION: $1.00 a month is appealing when you are setting up and designing a site. BUT!!! you are getting what you pay for. The home page Boast are NO LONGER TRUE! They were when I used this hosting for my sites for about 6 months, 3 years ago, NOT ANYMORE!!! The customer service is 24/7 HORRIBLE. If you venture in for the appealing $1.00 a month deal, just forget customer service, and put in a support ticket, you will spend less time waiting for an email than you will on a chat with customer service.

Also, I am pretty sure all of those other recent comments about how good the service is were written by the staff or the owners. But if you want to test the comments try it. They OFFER a 30 day money back guarantee???? At least that's what it says on the home page. Just remember if you use Paypal to pay for the service, I hear Paypal does a pretty good job of getting you your money back for you.

reviews.review_title: “BlueHost earned name--blue in the face from frustration of dealing with them”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
14 tech support phone calls in 2 weeks should be a red flag. Heck, it should be an arsenal....don't walk--RUN the other way as fast as you can. I host my personal email as well as business email and website through BlueHost and have for more than 3 years. Suddenly in the last year their serve tanked, as has my website and mail numerous times.
First let's talk about overall run time.  My website has been down more than 6 times in the last 8 months.  For a small business, that is a death sentence. It was even down the day I was scheduled for a redesign with my webmaster--great  My email went down several times as well, randomly, and I never knew it.  Then the biggie.
They shut off my accounts and turned off my website without notification.  It turned out they had expired. Well, I had called them more then 6 times, spending more than a total of 4 1/2 hours on hold trying to renew my accounts without ever being able to reach anyone.
So I renewed (don't ask me why), and they turned everything back on. The very next week I received a maintenance notice that they were doing "emergency" work on my server to protect my information and provide better service and my email would be down for 2 hours overnight. I awoke the next morning to NO email, past or present, so another 45 minute call for them to locate my emails and then reload them.
Let's talk about tech support.  I bought a new iPhone and changed from an android, so needed new settings.  That took 3 phone calls.  And then, after they reset my account, it took another 5 phone calls to get the correct settings for my iPad and iPhone, with each tech person telling me something different.  They told me they could only provide me one solution and if that didn't work, I had to call back. Really????
Tech support hold times average 30 minutes to 50 minute just to reach a live person.  They all will confidently provide you their working solution, but often it is incorrect, causing frustration and the need to start all over again.  There are no supervisors to talk with and they have removed any process by which you can file a complaint.
Bottom line--they were once in the top 10 hosting companies consistently and now are consistently omitted from the top ten list.  I think that says it all.

***Update 4/10/17 Email was once again totally wiped out. Took 47 minutes on hold, 19 minutes of issue "resolution" for them to tell me they didn't know what the issue was, but they could do a restore of the last backup from 3:23 am today.  So they did, and there were no emails since 4/2/17.  I tried to move service to another host company and BlueHost locked up emails.  Nothing is easy with this inept company.

Stay away!

My domain was stolen and their customer service is all over the place, am having a very hard time.  About a year ago I was worried my account had been compromised by some developers that used to have access to it, I wrote them with these concerns and they assured me everything was fine.  At that point I was busy with work and did not have time to re-purpose the domain, recently I wanted to bring her back to life and attempted to access by domain via bluehost.  I was unable to do so, my account had been stolen and the name had been changed.  I am no longer the owner of the account. 

I have had 2 agents over the phone confirm that they can see a lengthy support history with me.  We also found that in the bluehost TOS it states that one must give written consent to transfer ownership of a domain or a court order must be issued (section 4, A).  Neither of these happened, but they transferred ownership anyways, breaking their own TOS.  The last agent over the phone said that if I sent in my bank statements showing the original hosting charges and a copy of my photo ID via email they would restore the account to me.  Then via email they told me I needed to get a court order.  WTF?  Upon realizing I was being told different things by different people, I called back to get the name of the last person I spoke with.  The agent was extremely rude and said that they had no record of me calling.  Seriously guys... this is unnerving and you have a very mixed bag of agents and answers.

reviews.review_title: “Outstanding Customer Service and Tech Support - In Motion Hosting”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
As a web developer since 1995 I have worked with dozens of hosting companies over the years. I found In Motion Hosting through a client who was using them for their website hosting. About two years ago I purchased a VPS package with them and after a few months, I began moving a number of client websites over to the new VPS. I currently have about 35 client and personal hosting accounts within the VPS (Virtual Private Server).

For most website developers, having a responsive support team for troubleshooting websites is a necessity. Getting support is very straight forward. For non critical issues, I will open a support ticket and typically these tickets are responded to within an hour or two. They also offer online chat for more immediate issues and you can also talk to a support team member by phone.

WHAT IS SUPPORT?
Support is not where the hosting provider tells me how to build a website or how to install specific software on the server or how to tweak website code.

Support is help configuring the server or assisting when a WordPress website suddenly has a white screen or won't connect to a database. Or it is help when a website is moved from another server and the website is not displaying correctly on the new server.

Support is also help bridging the gap between what I can do with my WHM (Web Host Manager) dashboard and more complex situations where I need help getting pointed in the right direction.

In my opinion, In Motion Hosting sets a good example of how great customer service, a can-do attitude, and a consistent follow-through on technical issues all go together to create a great customer experience.

HOSTING VALUE
Often web developers gravitate to the lowest cost hosting companies, which is fine in theory. Who doesn't want a lot for very little?  But my experience has shown that you get what you pay for.

Typically, low cost hosting services cut corners in order to provide extremely low cost hosting and often this means tech support suffers. I have learned this lesson the hard way.

I have also learned that my time is valuable, and hosting companies like In Motion Hosting who are responsive and helpful make my job easier and actually save me time. The last thing I need is for a technical issue to drag on for several days and for a client to have a problem with their website that drags on and on.

With In Motion Hosting I have the confidence that they are there to help me when I need help and they keep everything running smoothly.

I believe their pricing to be competitive and while they are not the least expensive, they are not the most expensive, and for me, they provide value.

Recently I added a second VPS and I will soon have another 10 or so websites moved over from my old hosting company.

Lastly, I am not being paid to offer this review.

website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I chose 247-Host after doing a lot research and saw it getting lots of good reviews. I signed up for shared hosting and proceeded to move several domains to my account.

Almost immediately I had a small issue where the system didn't respond for about 10 minutes every day from about 7am. I assume this is due to backups being performed. Bandwidth was ok, but other hosts have much faster page load times.

My trouble started when I woke up one morning with my entire account suspended. At 2am I had received an email from 247-Host informing me that one of my domains was causing too much load on their servers, CPU usage was 100% and I should sort it out. At 4am I got an email telling me that they had suspended my account due to the issue.

I also had irate people shouting at me because their emails (which are for business) were now not working. This is a big issue. Surely their tech's could have taken down the offending page without suspending everything?

They then accused me of violating their terms of service by running an IRC chat on their server. Their technical knowledge is obviously very limited because they can't tell the difference between running an IRC server and LINKING to an IRC CLIENT in an iframe. They tell me this script was causing the issue:

1. There is no way linking to a script that IS NOT on their server can cause the CPU to run at 100%

2. I moved the site to a new server and the CPU load sits at a constant 0%.

I deduce therefore that their server configuration is screwed up.

I subsequently cancelled my account and asked for a refund of the remaining term which they refused to do, because I violated their term of service.

The obviously have no clue what they are doing.

All I can say is, STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOST!

reviews.review_title: “Not as good as they used to be”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I've been using Webs.com since I first started publishing, back in 2010 or so. They were very simple websites, but they were easy to build and it was free. I eventually paid for my own domain. But the 10 pages I used to be able to have on the free site suddenly said I couldn't go over 5, with no warning. So...I sucked it up and I paid for premium (so that I could use unlimited pages) which required me to sign up for a premium package. But I was adding the premium before my domain had expired and the started package includes a domain. So I went into their forums and specifically asked if the "free domain" I would get from the starter package could be used for my current domain. I was told, "Oh yeah, sure," that the "coupon" i get would be automatically applied to my account. But it didn't. The time came that my domain was expiring (a domain name that is now attached to every book I've published). When I inquired why this wasn't happening, the guy who emailed me back said something along the lines of, "Oh sorry, she was wrong, the coupons can only be used on NEW sites." So, I paid to keep my domain, because transferring the domain somewhere is a pain and I didn't have enough time to look into it. I still have that "free domain" coupon, because I can't use it. 

Sometime last year is when I started noticing the big problems. Website pages would lag on loading, or the site would go down completely. It always came back up and I still had at least a year on my domain. But one day, the site builder stopped working. Long story short, I found they deleted the theme I only just a week prior switched, rendering it useless. Without even bothering to tell me. I found out when my website wouldn't publish. 

Then the site builder went down. I couldn't even access my dashboard, let alone pay for a subscription had I wanted to. Nothing worked. And apparently it happened to hundreds of sites and the only answers we were given was along the lines of "we're working on it." 

Eventually, the problem got fixed, but it went down again recently. I currently canNOT turn off my "auto-renew" on my domain (and I want to because they're not getting anymore of my money). Odd pictures just started showing up on my published website. As in, pictures that aren't even in my files. And the pictures that were supposed to be there were still in my files. It made no sense. I had to re-upload the very same pictures. Something I've had do a lot over the last couple of years. 

So I went looking into their help forums. They used to leave threads telling us what problems they were noticing etc. Suddenly there are NONE of these threads. Just a very generic "help" menu. I sent them an email, telling them about the problems i was having, but heard nothing.  

Also, they send me a LOT of spam when they have sale on premium packages. I'm already a premium member, yet they still send me these. At least 1 every day. Oh, and when you sign up for the premium packages, they also don't tell you that their "premium themes" don't apply to the "starter" package (which I only subscribe for so I can get unlimited pages). You have to pay for the more expensive package if you want anything other than a no-frills theme. 

I have a few months left before my domain runs out next (I paid for 2 years; they never told me 1 year was possible. I only found out from other users on their FB page), but I'm going to take the time to transfer my domain somewhere else. Because the site just isn't as good as it used to be anymore and I'm sick of it. If I end up losing my domain name I'm going to be really angry.

reviews.review_title: “Don't use webs.com for your business website”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I starting using webs.com in 5th grade to build stupid websites for my friends because it was free to use and I liked building websites. Fast forward to the summer of 2015 when I decided I wanted to create a professional website for my photography. I used webs because it was the cheapest option and the only site I felt comfortable using. At first, I loved the look of my site and I felt like a real professional. When I started looking at other photographers' websites for inspiration and guidance, I began to notice how unprofessional my site looked compared to theirs. I decided to reach out to webs.com and asked to transfer my domain in early 2016 and was told I couldn't. I just stuck with the site hoping I could make it look more professional but couldn't. Now a year later, I'm FINALLY just being able to transfer my domain to another service that has more professional templates and is easier to contact. I requested a domain transfer on Janurary 21, 2017 and was told that the transfer would be complete on Janurary 28, 2017 at 1:55AM. It is now 12:30PM on Janurary 28th and my domain still hasn't transferred. When I contacted the support team, I was told that they would let the senior techs know about my situation and they'd complete the transfer. When I asked to speak to a supervisor or a senior tech, I was told that they're not available on weekends and theyll take care of my request on Monday. I've never experienced such unprofessionalism from a company before. I can't wait to break away from webs and start my site from scratch. 

If you're looking to create a website for your company, stay away from webs.com because they're unprofessional and your site will look unprofessional.

reviews.review_title: “Deceptive Advertising, horrible customer service and RESOLD MY SERVER!”
website_name: Sitejabber Online Business Reviews and Complaints
reviews.review_text:
I am beyond disappointed in this company. First I ordered a server and they had a deal ADVERTISED that if you pay for a quarter adding cpanel was free so I purchased it and paid for quarterly in advance. They made me jump through hoops for my credit card sending in scans and all that then they approved it and said they were setting up the server (but they lied). After waiting a whole day they send me a email saying I have to pay $115 extra to get cpanel WHICH THEY ADVERTISED FOR FREE. We went back and forth and they refused to honor what they advertised then they write and tell me they resold my server. The server that they CHARGED ME FOR and which they were supposedly SETTING UP. So they have been lying to me the whole time, misrepresenting what they are selling then reselling after charging my card and trying to downgrade me to a inferior server seems a lot like FRAUD to me.

This is horrible customer service. They should honor what they advertise and at least provide the server they sold me and CHARGED ME FOR.

My hope is somebody from Gigapros in management will care enough about me as a customer or at least about the negative publicity to contact me and offer me a fair resolution. I am not asking for more than I paid for just what I paid for and it made right.
